title: 9/11 was avenged on us. On its anniversary, I refuse to forgive
summary: As America mourns its dead, it forgets the millions brutalised in its wars of revenge.

title: Suspect in US school shooting dies of self-inflicted wounds: Police
summary: The two teenage students injured in the shooting at Evergreen High School are in stable condition, police said.

title: France’s streets ablaze as antigovernment protests disrupt daily life
summary: Hundreds arrested after more than 200,000 demonstrators force French government into high-stakes confrontation.

title: At least 14 killed in flash floods in Indonesia, most on island of Bali
summary: President Prabowo Subianto orders acceleration of search operations and handling of aftermath of deadly flooding.

title: Who recognises Palestine and who doesn’t?
summary: Most of the world’s countries recognise the state of Palestine. So, what’s stopping it from becoming a reality?

title: LIVE: Charlie Kirk, Trump ally, shot and killed with manhunt underway
summary: Kirk was a regular presence on cable TV where he leaned into the culture wars and heaped praise on President Trump.

title: Three dead, dozens injured in Mexico City gas tanker explosion
summary: An investigation has been launched to determine the cause of the explosion that wounded at least 70 people.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,295
summary: Here are the key events on day 1,295 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Israel’s President Herzog said ‘argued out of respect’ with British PM
summary: Downing Street later stressed that ‘the UK and Israel are longstanding allies’ despite their differences.

title: Tributes pour in for slain US conservative activist Charlie Kirk
summary: US President Trump and other political leaders have sent their condolences after slaying of 31-year-old activist.

title: India vs Pakistan – Asia Cup 2025: Match start time, team news and lineups
summary: From head-to-head results to predicted XIs and tickets, here's Al Jazeera's guide to the India-Pakistan match in Dubai.

title: Who was Charlie Kirk? What we know about the shooting and the suspect
summary: Video of the incident shows Charlie Kirk speaking to a large outdoor crowd when a gunshot rings out.

title: LIVE: Israel kills 70 in Gaza, Qatar PM accuses Israel of ‘state terrorism’
summary: Israeli forces killed more than 70 people in Gaza on Wednesday and launched deadly attacks on Yemen.

title: ‘Gulf region at risk’: Qatar seeks ‘collective response’ to Israeli attack
summary: Qatar's PM accuses Netanyahu of leading the region into 'chaos' as regional leaders stand in solidarity with Qatar.

title: Why did Israel strike Doha?
summary: What Israel’s unprecedented attack on Doha tells us about the future of Gaza and its relationship with the US.

title: Israël : un nouveau missile houthi intercepté après des frappes mortelles sur le Yémen
summary: L'armée israélienne a déclaré jeudi avoir intercepté un missile tiré depuis le Yémen, au lendemain d'une frappe israélienne sur des sites houthis yéménites qui ont fait 35 morts et 131 blessés selon ces rebelles.

title: Frappes au Qatar : Netanyahu repousse les limites dans sa guerre contre le Hamas
summary: Les frappes israéliennes inédites contre les responsables du Hamas au Qatar démontrent que le Premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu agit avec de moins en moins de lignes rouges dans sa guerre pour décapiter le mouvement islamiste. Même si le prix à payer peut être très élevé.

title: L'armée israélienne détruit une nouvelle tour d'habitation à Gaza-ville
summary: Israël a affirmé, mardi 9 septembre, que son armée allait opérer avec une “puissance accrue” à Gaza-ville, dont elle a sommé les habitants de partir.

title: La flottille pour Gaza affirme qu'un autre de ses bateaux a été touché
summary: La flottille pour Gaza a affirmé qu'un autre de ses bateaux avait été touché dans la nuit de mardi à mercredi près de Tunis et dit soupçonner un drone, 24 heures après un incident similaire. Récit d'Olivier Faissolle.

title: Le Qatar se réserve le droit de répondre à l'attaque israélienne, affirme son Premier ministre
summary: Le Qatar continuera de jouer le rôle de médiateur dans la guerre à Gaza malgré l'attaque israélienne qui a ciblé des responsables du Hamas à Doha, a affirmé mardi son Premier ministre.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu somme le Qatar d'expulser ou de juger les "terroristes" sur son sol
summary: Israël "agira contre ses ennemis, où qu'ils soient", a affirmé mercredi le ministre de la Défense Israël Katz, au lendemain de frappes israéliennes au Qatar ayant ciblé des responsables du Hamas. Le Premier ministre israélien a sommé Doha d'expulser ou de juger les "terroristes" sur son sol. De son côté, son homologue qatari a affirmé que Benjamin Netanyahu devait être traduit en justice après l'attaque, estimant qu'elle a "tué tout espoir" de libérer les otages. Voici le fil du 10 septembre.

title: La flottille pour Gaza affirme avoir été de nouveau visée au large de Tunis
summary: Alors que la flottille humanitaire pour Gaza doit partir cette semaine, un autre de ses bateaux a été touché dans la nuit de mardi à mercredi dans les eaux tunisiennes, a annoncé la "Global Sumud Flotilla", qui soupçonne, comme la veille, une attaque de drone.

title: Elizabeth Tsurkov, otage israélo-russe kidnappée en Irak en 2023, a été libérée
summary: Le président américain, Donald Trump, a annoncé, mardi, que l'otage israélo-russe Elizabeth Tsurkov, kidnappée en Irak en 2023, venait "juste d'être libérée" par la milice chiite des Brigades du Hezbollah, un influent groupe armé irakien pro-iranien.

title: Nucléaire : l'Iran et l'AIEA conviennent d'un nouveau cadre de coopération
summary: Lors d'une rencontre au Caire mardi, le patron de l'AIEA et le chef de la diplomatie iranienne ont signé un accord intitulé "Modalités techniques pour la mise en œuvre des inspections" des activités nucléaires en Iran. Un nouveau cadre de coopération décidé alors que la collaboration entre l'agence internationale et Téhéran avait été suspendue après la guerre déclenchée le 13 juin par une attaque sans précédent d'Israël sur le sol iranien.

title: Incendie sur un bateau de la Flottille pour Gaza : ce que disent les images
summary: Le Family Madeira, navire principal de la Flotille Sumud à destination de Gaza, dit avoir été frappé par un objet incendiaire dans la nuit du lundi 8 au mardi 9 septembre, peu après minuit. Les images montrent un objet incendiaire frapper le bateau. La rédaction des Observateurs a sollicité un expert pour les décrypter.

title: Frappe israélienne au Qatar : l'ancien ambassadeur de France réagit
summary: Israël a déclaré mardi avoir lancé une attaque contre les dirigeants du Hamas au Qatar, étendant encore ses opérations militaires au Moyen-Orient pour inclure cet État arabe du Golfe où se situe de longue date la base politique du groupe islamiste palestinien. L'analyse de Bertrand Besancenot, ancien ambassadeur de France au Qatar.

title: Israël cible le Hamas au Qatar, Washington prend ses distances
summary: Israël a lancé mardi une attaque contre les dirigeants du Hamas au Qatar, étendant encore ses opérations militaires au Moyen-Orient. Une opération qui a mis "très mal à l'aise" le président américain Donald Trump, selon les mots de la Maison Blanche, et qui a été vivement condamnée par des pays du monde arabe, mais aussi par la France, l'Allemagne et le Royaume-Uni.

title: L'offensive de l'armée israélienne à Gaza-ville "sert à organiser une déportation de masse"
summary: L'armée israélienne a ordonné mardi aux habitants de la ville de Gaza d'évacuer avant le lancement d'une offensive élargie visant à s'emparer du plus grand centre urbain du territoire. Un avertissement qui laisse présager une incursion terrestre imminente. Ancien officier et analyste militaire, Guillaume Ancel y voit le début d'une "opération de déportation de masse".

title: Le Hamas affirme que ses dirigeants ont survécu aux frappes israéliennes à Doha
summary: L'armée israélienne a annoncé mardi avoir mené une frappe contre des "hauts responsables" du mouvement islamiste palestinien Hamas, peu de temps après que des explosions ont été entendues à Doha. Le Qatar a dénoncé une attaque "lâche", tandis que Donald Trump s'est montré contrarié par ces frappes. Le Hamas affirme que ses dirigeants ont survécu. Voici le fil du 9 septembre 2025.

title: Le Maroc mise sur le développement de Dakhla, au Sahara occidental
summary: Nous vous emmenons au Sahara occidental, territoire disputé depuis cinquante ans entre le Maroc et les combattants indépendantistes du Front Polisario, soutenus par l'Algérie. Au niveau diplomatique la situation semble être en train de changer. Ces dernières années de nombreux pays, comme les Etats-Unis ou la France, ont choisi de soutenir le plan proposé par Rabat pour une autonomie du Sahara occidental sous souveraineté marocaine. La région est aussi en train de changer de visage à grande vitesse avec des investissements massifs, en particulier dans la ville de Dakhla. Nos reporters Achraf Abid et Clovis Casali ont pu s'y rendre.

title: En direct, Gaza : suivez nos dernières informations
summary: L’Organisation mondiale de la santé a affirmé qu’elle allait rester dans la ville de Gaza, en dépit des appels d’Israël pour que les habitants évacuent le principal centre urbain du territoire palestinien.

title: Au Malawi, un duel électoral sur fond de détresse économique
summary: Les favoris du scrutin du 16 septembre sont l’actuel président, Lazarus Chakwera, et son prédécesseur, Peter Mutharika, dont les mandats ont été marqués par une spirale d’inflation, de pénuries et de chômage.

title: En Europe, la perspective de faire payer l’usage des réseaux télécoms aux géants américains de la tech s’assombrit
summary: Alors que les opérateurs européens militent pour que les Google, Meta, Amazon ou Netflix financent en partie leurs infrastructures, Bruxelles s’est engagé auprès de Washington à ne pas adopter de « redevances d’utilisation des réseaux ».

title: En direct, guerre en Ukraine : la Pologne établit une « no fly zone » à la frontière entre la Biélorussie et l’Ukraine
summary: Varsovie a annoncé, jeudi, la limitation du trafic aérien à sa frontière orientale à la suite de l’intrusion d’une vingtaine de drones présumés russes sur son territoire dans la nuit de mardi à mercredi. Cette restriction sera en vigueur jusqu’au 9 décembre.

title: Cuba : nouvelle panne générale d’électricité, la cinquième en moins d’un an
summary: Mercredi matin, un arrêt de la centrale électrique Antonio-Guiteras, située au centre de l’île, a provoqué la déconnexion du système électrique sur l’ensemble du pays.

title: « Pour dénouer l’impasse française, pourquoi ne pas faire appel à l’Européen Mario Draghi ? »
summary: Dans une tribune au « Monde », les chercheurs Sylvain Kahn et Nicolas Roussellier estiment que la sortie de crise politique ne saurait être strictement nationale. Ils en appellent à des solutions européennes et à la création d’un comité d’experts, placé sous la houlette de l’ancien président de la Banque centrale européenne Mario Draghi.

title: Etats-Unis : les salariés sud-coréens arrêtés vont être libérés et ne seront pas expulsés, a décidé Washington, mais Séoul préfère les rapatrier
summary: Le président sud-coréen, Lee Jae-myung, a annoncé que l’intervention de la police de l’immigration, au cours de laquelle les salariés ont été enchaînés et menottés, pourrait avoir un « impact significatif sur les décisions d’investissement futures » aux Etats-Unis.

title: En Ukraine et à Gaza, Donald Trump apparaît comme un spectateur impuissant, dominé par les événements
summary: En vingt-quatre heures, le président américain a été pris de court sur les deux dossiers majeurs de politique étrangère dans lesquels il a choisi de s’investir lourdement. Dans les deux cas, aucune stratégie claire ne se dessine.

title: L’OTAN face au dilemme de la multiplication des provocations militaires russes
summary: Dans la nuit de mardi à mercredi, alors que Moscou avait envoyé une vague de 450 drones contre les villes de l’ouest de l’Ukraine, la Pologne a enregistré l’incursion de dix-neuf engins volant dans son espace aérien, déclenchant un engagement inédit de l’Alliance.

title: Le combat de la médecin Angel Foster pour le droit à l’avortement aux Etats-Unis
summary: « L’Amérique des “résistantes” » (4/5). La docteure, à l’initiative du Massachusetts Medication Abortion Access Project, aide des milliers de femmes à avorter, malgré les restrictions de l’administration Trump.

title: « Dans les Etats-Unis de Trump, le loyalisme compte plus que l’expertise »
summary: Le président américain, qui estime être, le temps de son mandat, propriétaire de l’Etat fédéral, menace les agences indépendantes qui font la réputation du pays, que ce soit en matière sanitaire, environnementale ou financière, relève Alain Frachon, éditorialiste au « Monde », dans sa chronique.

title: Au Japon, le business juteux et inavouable des photos d’échographies
summary: Le site nippon de ventes entre particuliers Mercari a interdit, le 1ᵉʳ septembre, le commerce des clichés de fœtus. Des femmes les achetaient pour convaincre des hommes de les épouser ou pour leur soutirer de l’argent.

title: Ursula von der Leyen peine à convaincre le Parlement européen de la cohérence de son action
summary: Devant les eurodéputés, la présidente de la Commission a proposé des mesures ciblant Israël pour la guerre menée à Gaza, mais est restée globalement d’une grande prudence sur nombre de sujets, faute de majorité.

title: A Mexico, l’explosion d’un camion-citerne transportant du gaz fait trois morts et 67 blessés
summary: L’accident s’est produit alors que le véhicule passait sur un pont, dans le district d’Iztapalapa, l’une des zones les plus peuplées du pays. Le drame a ravivé le traumatisme d’accidents passés liés au transport de combustibles.

title: Le Ghana accepte d’accueillir des Africains de l’Ouest expulsés des Etats-Unis
summary: L’accord a été conclu sur fond de tensions entre les deux pays, alors que Washington a augmenté les droits de douane sur les produits ghanéens et restreint le nombre de visas.

title: Around 200,000 Palestinians forced to flee Gaza City: Report
summary:
Around 200,000 Palestinians forced to flee Gaza City: Report

Tens of thousands of Palestinians have fled Gaza City in recent days as Israeli forces prepare to intensify their onslaught on the besieged city, the Times of Israel reports, citing Israeli military sources.

The mass expulsion has forced around 200,000 people from the city in recent weeks, according to estimates reported by the Times of Israel and Israel’s Channel 12.

Rights groups have condemned the escalating attacks. Amnesty International warned the assaults will have “catastrophic and irreversible consequences” for Palestinians.

title: Israeli president says he 'argued' with 'ally' Starmer during tense Downing Street meeting
summary:
Israeli president says he 'argued' with 'ally' Starmer during tense Downing Street meeting

Israeli President Isaac Herzog said he "argued" but also had points of agreement with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer during their latest meeting at Downing Street on Wednesday.

"We had a very frank and open discussion," Herzog said at a closed event hosted by the Chatham House think tank in London, as hundreds of anti-war protesters rallied outside against his appearance at the world-renowned institute.

"It was a meeting between allies, but it was a tough meeting," he said.

"It was a meeting at which things were said that were tough and strong. And clearly we can argue, because when allies meet we can argue."

Herzog had met Starmer earlier in the day at Downing Street - just hours after the prime minister condemned Israel's strike on a residential building in the Qatari capital Doha, where senior Hamas members had gathered to examine the latest US proposal for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip.

Read m0re: Israeli president says he 'argued' with 'ally' Starmer during tense Downing Street meeting

title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian waiting for aid in Gaza, hospitals report more casualties
summary:
Israeli forces kill Palestinian waiting for aid in Gaza, hospitals report more casualties

Al-Awda Hospital has reported that Israeli forces shot and killed a Palestinian who was waiting for aid north of the Nuseirat camp in central Gaza.

Meanwhile, the Baptist Hospital confirmed that a woman was killed and several others injured in an Israeli air raid on the Shuja'iyya neighbourhood, east of Gaza City.

title: WHO chief rejects Israeli order to evacuate Gaza City
summary:
WHO chief rejects Israeli order to evacuate Gaza City

World Health Organization chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus says his agency and its partners will not leave Gaza City despite evacuation orders issued by the Israeli military.

“WHO is appalled by the latest evacuation order, demanding that one million people move from Gaza City to a so-called ‘humanitarian zone’ in the south designated by Israel,” Tedros said in a statement.

He stressed that the area lacks the space and resources to cope: “The zone has neither the size nor scale of services to support those already there, let alone new arrivals.”

“Almost half the functional hospitals are in Gaza City,” he said and reassuring civilians that WHO will remain in Gaza City.

Tedros urged the international community to act, calling for an immediate ceasefire and guarantees for the safety of medical facilities, aid workers and civilians across the besieged territory.

.@WHO is appalled by the latest evacuation order, demanding that one million people move from Gaza City to a so-called “humanitarian zone” in the south designated by Israel.

To civilians in Gaza: WHO and partners remain in Gaza City.

To the international community: Act.

This… pic.twitter.com/TkDtu8sHol

— Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus (@DrTedros) September 10, 2025

title: Israeli forces shoot dead Palestinian child in central Gaza
summary:
Israeli forces shoot dead Palestinian child in central Gaza

Israeli forces have shot and killed a Palestinian child in the Bureij refugee camp in central Gaza, reported Al Jazeera Arabic. The report cites medical staff at al-Awda Hospital as the source.

title: Tunisia probes drone strike on Gaza aid flotilla ship at port
summary:
Tunisia probes drone strike on Gaza aid flotilla ship at port

Tunisia has said the “assault” on a vessel docked at Sidi Bou Said port was “orchestrated”, after organisers of the Global Sumud Flotilla reported one of their boats was hit by a drone on Wednesday - the second such incident in as many days.

The flotilla, preparing to set sail for Gaza in a bid to break Israel’s naval blockade, has already faced two nights of drone strikes targeting ships in the convoy. Organisers described the attacks as deliberate attempts by Israel to sabotage their mission.

The Israeli military has not responded to requests for comment.

Authorities confirmed there were no casualties, and civil defence teams managed to extinguish a fire that broke out on the boat on Wednesday night. Tunisia’s Interior Ministry said investigations were under way, but stopped short of blaming any country.

Francesca Albanese, the UN’s Special Rapporteur on the occupied Palestinian territories, told Reuters the attack “is an attack against Tunisian sovereignty.”

title: Israeli military says it intercepted missile fired from Yemen
summary:
Israeli military says it intercepted missile fired from Yemen

Israel’s military says its air force has intercepted a ballistic missile launched from Yemen.

Air raid sirens went off in several communities across the Negev Desert in southern Israel shortly before the interception.

No casualties or damage have been reported.

title: Morning recap
summary:
Morning recap

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Welcome to our live coverage of Israel’s war on Gaza which is now in its 705th day.

At least 72 Palestinians were killed in Israeli bombardments across Gaza on Wednesday, including 53 people in Gaza City alone. In other developments:

  • Anger erupted worldwide after Israel targeted senior Hamas officials in Doha, prompting India, France, Russia and others to condemn the strike.

  • Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu demanded that Qatar either “expel” Hamas or “bring [them] to justice”, warning of further action if it refused.

  • Doha denounced his remarks as a “shameful attempt … to justify the cowardly attack that targeted Qatari territory”.

  • Israeli warplanes also struck Yemen’s capital, Sanaa, and surrounding areas, killing at least 35 people, according to the Houthi-run health ministry.

  • Israel has now bombed six countries since Monday – Palestine, Lebanon, Syria, Yemen, Tunisia and Qatar.

title: Seven children wounded in Israeli attack outside school in Gaza City
summary:
Seven children wounded in Israeli attack outside school in Gaza City

Ambulance crews transferred seven injured children for treatment after an Israeli attack on a group of people outside the Shuhada al-Shati school in Gaza City’s Nassr neighbourhood, Gaza’s civil defence said on Wednesday.  

Israel has issued expulsion orders for nearly one million Palestinian residents of Gaza City ahead of a planned ground offensive to occupy the famine-stricken city.

The toll of Palestinians killed in Gaza by Israeli forces since October 2023 has risen to over 64,605, according to the Palestinian health ministry. At least 163,319 others have been wounded during this time.

title: Israeli forces bomb tents of displaced Palestinians in Gaza City
summary:
Israeli forces bomb tents of displaced Palestinians in Gaza City

Israeli forces bombed the tents of displaced people around Yarmouk Street in Gaza City, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

Four Palestinians were injured in an Israeli attack on a house in the Al-Daraj neighborhood, east of Gaza City, the enclave's Emergency and Ambulance Authority said.

Israel has issued expulsion orders for nearly one million Palestinian residents of Gaza City ahead of a planned ground offensive to occupy the famine-stricken city.

The toll of Palestinians killed in Gaza by Israeli forces since October 2023 has risen to over 64,605, according to the Palestinian health ministry. At least 163,319 others have been wounded during this time. 

At least 2,444 aid seekers have been killed by Israeli forces and mercenaries, mostly at the scandal-plagued Gaza Humanitarian Foundation distribution centres, which the US and Israel back.

title: Blast site of Israel's attack on Qatar does not match narrative of operation, experts say
summary:
Blast site of Israel's attack on Qatar does not match narrative of operation, experts say

Key details are missing about how Israel carried out its unprecedented attack on Hamas leaders in Qatar, raising questions about whether the number of missiles fired attributed to Israel is correct or whether Israel had a team on the ground helping locate the group's officials.

To begin with, current and former US officials and analysts tell Middle East Eye that the blast site attributed to the Israeli attack is much too small to corroborate several media reports that Israel fired around 10 air-launched missiles into the building.

Some eyewitnesses reported hearing upwards of eight blasts during the attack, but experts say that some of those reports might have been confused with the echoing. 

“Based on the public source imagery of the site, we are talking about two or three missiles maximum going into that building,” Michael Knights, a military expert at Horizon Engage, an international consulting firm, told MEE.

Understanding how Israel conducted its attack is important because Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday that Israel could strike Hamas officials abroad again, potentially leaving the door open to attacks in Egypt and Turkey, where they travel. 

Read more: Blast site of Israel's attack on Qatar does not match narrative of operation, experts say

title: Qatar condemns Israeli PM's remarks on expelling Hamas negotiators
summary:
Qatar condemns Israeli PM's remarks on expelling Hamas negotiators

Qatar on Wednesday condemned Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's remarks on expelling Hamas members, calling them a “shameful attempt… to justify the cowardly attack that targeted Qatari territory, as well as the explicit threats of future violations of state sovereignty”.

“Netanyahu is fully aware that the hosting of the Hamas office took place within the framework of Qatar’s mediation efforts requested by the United States and Israel,” Qatar's foreign ministry said.

“He is also fully aware of the office’s role in facilitating numerous exchanges and ceasefires, which have been widely acknowledged and appreciated by the international community and have brought relief to Palestinian civilians and Israeli hostages in desperate need of basic humanitarian relief from the ruthlessness that has ensued since October 7th,” it added, referring to the war on Gaza that erupted after the Hamas-led attacks on southern Israel in October 2023. The war has now been deemed a genocide by scholars, historians and human rights groups, with over 64,000 dead.

“Such statements are hardly surprising coming from an individual who relies on extremist rhetoric to win elections and is wanted for international justice, facing mounting sanctions on a daily basis—factors that only deepen his isolation on the global stage."

Netanyahu earlier warned Qatar to either expel Hamas officials or “bring them to justice. Because if you don’t, we will.”

title: Blast site of Israel's attack on Qatar does not match narrative of operation, experts say
summary:
Blast site of Israel's attack on Qatar does not match narrative of operation, experts say

Submitted by Sean Mathews on Wed, 09/10/2025 - 21:47
There are unanswered questions about how many missiles Israel fired and whether it used spotters on the ground
This handout satellite photo, obtained on 10 September from Planet Labs PBC and dated 9 September 2025, shows the damaged building housing members of Hamas's political bureau after it was targeted by an Israeli strike in Qatar's capital, Doha (Planet Labs/AFP)
Off

Key details are missing about how Israel carried out its unprecedented attack on Hamas leaders in Qatar, raising questions about whether the number of missiles fired attributed to Israel is correct or whether Israel had a team on the ground helping locate the group's officials.

To begin with, current and former US officials and analysts tell Middle East Eye that the blast site attributed to the Israeli attack is much too small to corroborate several media reports that Israel fired around 10 air-launched missiles into the building.

Some eyewitnesses reported hearing upwards of eight blasts during the attack, but experts say that some of those reports might have been confused with the echoing. 

“Based on the public source imagery of the site, we are talking about two or three missiles maximum going into that building,” Michael Knights, a military expert at Horizon Engage, an international consulting firm, told MEE.

Understanding how Israel conducted its attack is important because Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday that Israel could strike Hamas officials abroad again, potentially leaving the door open to attacks in Egypt and Turkey, where they travel. 

Israel has been tight-lipped about how it conducted this strike, but US officials who spoke with MEE say that Israel appeared to launch its attack from outside Qatari airspace - a point echoed by many analysts.

Jordan said that no Israeli aircraft violated its airspace during the operation. Israel used Syrian and Iraqi airspace to launch its attack on Iran earlier this summer.

If Israel wanted to refrain from violating Saudi Arabian or Kuwaiti airspace, it could have done the same and fired into Qatar from Iraq, Andrew Curtis, a retired air commodore in Britain's Royal Air Force and associate fellow at the Royal United Services Institute, told MEE.

MEE has reported that the Trump administration was notified of the attack in advance and did not object to it.

Curtis said that there would have been plenty of opportunities for the US to be aware of the mission, given the detailed planning and time required.

“The suggestion that, oh, this was a target of opportunity and we acted does not hold up,” Curtis said. “This would have been days in planning at minimum.”

What missiles did Israel use?

If Israel fired into Qatar from Iraqi airspace, that would disqualify its use of small-diameter bombs like the GBU-39B, given its short glide range.

Officials and analysts say that the small scale of damage photographed in Qatar disqualifies all but a few types of missiles that would be used in a “stand-off” strike - where war planes fire missiles in the air from a distance to their target.

One of Israel’s smallest air-launched missiles is the Delilah cruise missile. Its warhead is more consistent with the small-scale damage seen in photographs.

Israel killed at least six people - including a member of Qatar's security forces - but missed its main targets, Hamas’s senior political officials.

The attack failed because Israel bombed a building close to where senior Hamas officials were meeting, but not the exact location. The true meeting point was disguised for security measures, a source told MEE.

Israel's attack on Qatar eviscerates promise of US security umbrella for Gulf
Read More »

Another option is that Israel used an air-launched ballistic missile, like the Silver Sparrow, with a range of 1,500 kilometres.

Although that kind of missile would normally do much more damage to the target that is visible, Knights said Israel could have “fused” it - meaning that the warhead's explosive material did not detonate until it was underground. That would have limited shrapnel and the risks of wider damage.

“Israel can do all kinds of things to reduce the explosive charge of the warhead to limit the damage,” he told MEE.

Israel’s F-35I Adir fighter jets are known to carry Delilah cruise missiles and Rampage air-to-ground missiles.

Analysts tell MEE that Israel would likely have used an F-15 or F-16 to carry a Silver Sparrow. That would have compromised stealth features.

Curtis told MEE that Israel’s operation may not have stopped in the air. “They very well could have had spotters on the ground watching that building to see who was arriving,” he told MEE.

One Arab official told MEE that Gulf countries have not ruled out that Israel dispatched a team to the ground in Doha as part of the operation.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Israeli police arrest activist for sharing Nepal video on social media
summary:
Israeli police arrest activist for sharing Nepal video on social media

Israeli activist Dr Yolanda Yavor of Tel Aviv University was arrested on Wednesday for writing a post on social media, Israeli media reported, quoting local police.

Police said that Yavor shared a video about the torching of the home of the Nepali prime minister and "wrote a message encouraging such an act against Netanyahu".

Yavor was active in the Caesarea protest movement against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Human remains found at site of Israeli strike in Doha, says Qatar
summary:
Human remains found at site of Israeli strike in Doha, says Qatar

Human remains were recovered from the site of an Israeli strike that hit a Hamas residential compound in Doha, Qatar's interior ministry said on Wednesday. 

News agency Anadolu reported that efforts are underway to identify the victims.

The ministry also confirmed the death of Jihad Lubad, director of the office of Hamas leader Khalil al-Hayya, in Tuesday’s attack.

It added that “human remains were found at different parts of the site, with Qatar’s disaster victim identification unit working to establish the victims’ identities with accuracy.”

title: Ingush man accused of justifying terrorism over 2-year old Telegram post

title: Wednesday, 10 September 2025
summary: Regional * Georgia’s State Security Service (SSG) has reported that a Georgian citizen was ‘illegally detained’ near the village of Zemo Khviti in the Gori municipality. title: OSCE says late invitation to Georgia’s local elections ‘makes meaningful observation impossible’
summary: The invitation was sent in early September, less than a month ahead of election day on 4 October.

summary: The exercises brought special forces from five other countries, including Turkey.
